question.title: Does not find a class when starting Fat-Jar in JavaFx
question.body:
I have a JavaFX application. I want to create a JAR file, for this I used the Maven Shade Plugin to create a fat JAR.

This is the structure of my project:

pom.xml:

<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" 
    xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
    xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 https://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
    <groupId>VK_SENDER</groupId>
    <artifactId>VK_SENDER</artifactId>
    <version>1.0.0</version>

    <properties>
        <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
        <java.version>21</java.version> 
    </properties>

    <dependencies>

        <!--
        https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/de.jensd/fontawesomefx-fontawesome -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>de.jensd</groupId>
            <artifactId>fontawesomefx-fontawesome</artifactId>
            <version>4.7.0-9.1.2</version>
        </dependency>
        
        
                <!-- https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/junit/junit -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>junit</groupId>
            <artifactId>junit</artifactId>
            <version>4.13.2</version>
        </dependency>
        
        <!-- https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.postgresql/postgresql -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.postgresql</groupId>
            <artifactId>postgresql</artifactId>
            <version>42.7.5</version>
        </dependency>
        
        

        <!-- JavaFX Controls -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.openjfx</groupId>
            <artifactId>javafx-controls</artifactId>
            <version>21</version>
        </dependency>

        <!-- JavaFX FXML -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.openjfx</groupId>
            <artifactId>javafx-fxml</artifactId>
            <version>21</version>
        </dependency>
        
        <!-- https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.mockito/mockito-all -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.mockito</groupId>
            <artifactId>mockito-all</artifactId>
            <version>1.10.19</version>
        </dependency>

        

        <!-- VK API SDK -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>com.vk.api</groupId>
            <artifactId>sdk</artifactId>
            <version>1.0.14</version>
        </dependency>

        <!-- Netty Transport -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>io.netty</groupId>
            <artifactId>netty-transport</artifactId>
            <version>4.1.33.Final</version>
        </dependency>

        <!-- Apache HttpClient -->

        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.apache.httpcomponents</groupId>
            <artifactId>httpclient</artifactId>
            <version>4.3.1</version>
            <exclusions>
                <exclusion>
                    <artifactId>commons-logging</artifactId>
                    <groupId>commons-logging</groupId>
                </exclusion>
            </exclusions>
        </dependency>
        
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId>
            <artifactId>jcl-over-slf4j</artifactId>
            <version>1.7.36</version>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId>
            <artifactId>slf4j-api</artifactId>
            <version>1.7.5</version>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>


    <build>
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-shade-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.5.1</version>
                <executions>
                    <execution>
                        <phase>package</phase>
                        <goals>
                            <goal>shade</goal>
                        </goals>
                        <configuration>
                            <transformers>
                                <transformer implementation="org.apache.maven.plugins.shade.resource.ManifestResourceTransformer">
                                    <mainClass>vksender.VkSender</mainClass>
                                </transformer>
                            </transformers>
                            <filters>
                                <filter>
                                    <artifact>*:*</artifact>
                                    <excludes>
                                        <exclude>META-INF/*.SF</exclude>
                                        <exclude>META-INF/*.DSA</exclude>
                                        <exclude>META-INF/*.RSA</exclude>
                                    </excludes>
                                </filter>
                            </filters>
                            <shadedArtifactAttached>true</shadedArtifactAttached>
                            <shadedClassifierName>fat</shadedClassifierName>
                        </configuration>
                    </execution>
                </executions>
            </plugin>

            <!-- Компиляция с Java 21 -->
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.13.0</version>
                <configuration>
                    <source>21</source>
                    <target>21</target>
                    <compilerArgs>
                        <arg>--add-modules</arg>
                        <arg>javafx.controls,javafx.fxml</arg>
                    </compilerArgs>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>
</project>

Next, I introduced the mvn clean package command. In the target/, I get my vk_sender-1.0.0-fit.jar, but then with java -jar vk_sender-1.0.0-fat.jar I get an error:

Error: Could not find or load main class vksender.VkSender Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: vksender.VkSender

If this is related to the modularity of my project, what to do then? How to assemble my project in a JAR file?

I tried the maven-assembly-plugin, but then I also get the error.

question_comments.body: What does jar --list --file <jarfile> output? Are your classes in there?

Fat/uber/shadowed JAR files are not really compatible with JPMS modules. Consider excluding all module-info.class files. And if this is your only deployment strategy then you might want to consider making your own project non-modular. Also, make sure you have a separate "launcher" main class (that simply launches JavaFX). The JavaFX platform only supports being loaded as named modules; if it's not loaded as named modules then the main class cannot be a subtype of Application.
As an aside, you should declare test dependencies to be in the test scope.
The class is genuinely not in the JAR at the expected path, or the Manifest's Main-Class entry is pointing to the wrong FQN.

I believe you can try reading these answers - they might be helpful to you. 1. Could not find or load main class 2. more about this error 3. Eclipse+Maven src/main/java not visible in src folder in Package Explorer

It seems your directory structure might not be following the Maven standard. Specifically, your vksender folder should be located under src/main/java. Here are some relevant resources: 0. 📁 Introduction to the Standard Directory Layout (Maven)
